title: Glencore director puts money back on the table
text:

Fri, Oct 2, 2015, 22:38 BST - UK Markets closed Glencore director puts money back on the table By Edward Swift | Sharecast – 4 hours ago 683.00 +10.50 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - Glencore (Xetra: A1JAGV - news ) director William Macaulay has reinvested in the company as it continues its slow rebound. The non-executive director personally purchased 1.7m shares on Thursday at a price of 90.91p per share and cost him a total of nearly £1.55m. He's the latest in the long line of directors to front up cash to vouch for the mining company. 
However it's only a fraction of the £118m of shares that FR Galaxy Holdings, of which Macaulay is a connected person, sold up in May and June. 
Derwent London (LSE: DLN.L - news ) chief executive John Burns and executive director Simon Silver also took home a nice top up in time for the weekend, as they cashed in 43,746 and 30,000 shares respectively. 
The company has seen steady growth in the share price over the last twelve months, and the pair took nearly £1.6m and £1.1m each to the bank.
